title: Will there be a series 2 of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions?
text:
Twist and Pulse took the Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions title (Picture: BBC)

Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions crowned its winner on Saturday night, with dance duo Twist And Pulse being named ultimate champions.

The pair won the series ahead of fellow dance duo Stavros Flatley, in a final which also saw acts from the US, Ukraine, Canada and Germany competing for the title.

The show’s proven popular with fans with its mix of acts from the global Got Talent franchise combined with the return of some BGT favourites to the stage.

But will it be returning for a second series? Here’s what you need to know…

Will there be a second series of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions?

ITV has yet to confirm whether Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions will be back for a second series.

However the format has clearly proven popular – as its US counterpart America’s Got Talent: The Champions will be returning for a second series in the US in 2020.

There’s no shortage of former acts for the judges to preside over in a second series (Picture: ITV)

That series will feature BGT stalwarts Simon Cowell and Alesha Dixon on the panel, alongside Heidi Klum and Howie Mandel.

On that basis it’s fair to assume that BGT: The Champions could also be back for more next year – and there’s certainly no shortage of acts who could take to the stage once more.

Metro.co.uk has contacted ITV for comment.

How was the winner of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions chosen?

Winning duo Twist and Pulse were chosen as winners by a group of ‘superfans’ who were present at the Wembley Arena final.

The pair – made up of best friends Ashley Glazebrook and Glen Murphy – originally finished as runners-up in the 2010 series behind gymnastics troupe Spellbound, but took the trophy this time after winning Alesha Dixon’s Golden Buzzer and wowing the audience with their blend of dance and comedy.

Glen told the crowd: ‘I’m absolutely speechless, I can’t thank you guys enough,’ while Ashley added: ‘Yeah, literally feel amazing. I’ve said it before, things like this don’t happen to me and my best friend Glenn, so we’d just like to say thank you so much! ‘This means the world to us, honestly!’
